name: Texas Muslim Womens Foundation Inc
mission: Founded in 2005, Texas Muslim Women's Foundation (TMWF) aims to empower, promote and support all women and their families, with a special focus on North Texas. We are an equal opportunity provider. We engage all members of the community – women, men, seniors, families and youth through our various programs. We provide social and family violence services that foster peace and well-being in the home through our Peace in the Home Services and Peaceful Oasis Shelter. In addition, TMWF also arranges leadership skills development for Muslim youth to inspire the next generation to build a promising future for our society and educational programs for Muslim and non-Muslim community members to learn about topics essential to individual and community welfare.
theoryOfChange: The Texas Muslim Women's Foundation (TMWF) has a published report titled "From the Roots of Trauma to the Flowering of Trauma-Informed Care". This report details TMWF's four-year project to design and implement culturally-sensitive trauma-informed programming for domestic violence survivors and their children. It outlines their process of becoming a trauma-informed agency, which included learning about types of trauma and trauma-informed care, assessing existing culturally-sensitive practices, identifying new practices, training staff, and collaborating with researchers to document and build a body of evidence-based practice, all while maintaining a survivor-centered approach. The report articulates a model that integrates culturally-sensitive services and trauma-informed advocacy, which TMWF invites others to learn from and replicate.
zakatClaimEvidence: Dedicated zakat page found at https://www.tmwf.org/ways-to-give (Source: https://www.tmwf.org/ways-to-give)

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization shows high donor alignment for those seeking to support domestic poverty relief and Muslim-led social services [1]. Its zakat-eligible status and focus on asnaf categories further strengthen its fit for donors prioritizing Islamic philanthropic principles [2][8].
dimension_explanations.impact: The foundation demonstrates high impact through the direct provision of emergency shelter and transitional housing for domestic violence survivors [4][6]. With a program expense ratio of 86.0% and a high Charity Navigator score of 98.66666666666667/100, the organization efficiently converts its $4,665,216 in total revenue into tangible community benefits [1][3].

strengths.detail: The organization spends only <cite id="10">$0.03 to raise every $1</cite>, significantly outperforming industry averages for donor acquisition.
TMWF is <cite id="11">zakat-eligible</cite>, specifically serving the asnaf of <cite id="12">fuqara (poor), masakin (needy), and ibn sabil (wayfarers)</cite>.
The foundation earned <cite id="13">perfect scores of 100/100 for both Culture and Leadership</cite> from Charity Navigator.

strengths_deep_dive: TMWF's operational excellence is anchored by its direct service delivery model. In 2024, the foundation provided <cite id="14">emergency shelter to 137 residents</cite> and supported <cite id="15">216 non-residential domestic violence clients</cite>. This direct impact is supported by a <cite id="16">100% independent board</cite> and a <cite id="17">working capital ratio of 3.7 months</cite>, ensuring that resources are managed with high accountability and resilience.
rich_narrative.summary: The Texas Muslim Women's Foundation (TMWF) is a specialized social services organization that <cite id="1">empowers survivors of domestic violence</cite> through culturally sensitive intervention and prevention. Founded in <cite id="2">2005</cite>, the organization has evolved into a critical safety net for the North Texas region, specifically serving <cite id="3">Collin, Dallas, and Tarrant counties</cite>. TMWF operates with a high degree of financial efficiency, maintaining a <cite id="4">program expense ratio of 86.0%</cite> and an <cite id="5">overall score of 98.98.66666666666667/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the foundation reported <cite id="6">total revenue of $4,665,216</cite>, reflecting a <cite id="7">3-year revenue CAGR of 17.3%</cite>. Their service model is uniquely tailored to the needs of Muslim women, providing <cite id="8">emergency shelter for 186 survivors</cite> and supporting <cite id="9">204 individuals in transitional or rapid re-housing</cite> during 2023. By integrating Islamic values with professional social work, TMWF addresses the specific cultural barriers that often prevent Muslim survivors from seeking help, such as language access and religious dietary requirements.
